title: Travis Head, Kagiso Rabada among top T20 stars not retained for MLC 2025: Reports
body:
The 2025 Major League Cricket (MLC) franchise retentions do not include major names like Travis Head, Kagiso Rabada, and David Miller among others. The player draft for the third season is scheduled for Wednesday, February 19.

Defending champions Washington Freedom have retained the most players out of the six franchises, but star players like Travis Head, and Akeal Hosein are not part of the list. While Steve Smith has been retained by the side, Australia's tour of the Caribbean in the June-July window coinciding with MLC 2025, complicates his availability.

Runners-up San Francisco Unicorns have also released big names like Pat Cummins, Matt Henry, and Josh Inglis, but have retained the opening pair of Finn Allen and Jake Fraser-McGurk and pace spearhead Haris Rauf.

Kagiso Rabada, who has been part of the MI family through the MI Cape Town and the MI New York, has been released by the latter. Apart from the pacer, the inaugural MLC winners have also parted ways with other major names like Anrich Nortje, Dewald Brevis, and Tim David.

The Texas Super Kings have released star pacer Matheesha Pathirana, as well as Mitchell Santner, Naveen-ul-Haq, and Daryl Mitchell. Skipper Faf du Plessis, veteran opener Devon Conway, all-rounder Marcus Stoinis, and frontline spinner Noor Ahmad are the major names retained by the franchise.

Runners-up from the first season, the Seattle Orcas plan on a major revamp after their dismal 2024 campaign. They have retained only seven players, the least among all teams, with South Africa's Heinrich Klaasen and Ryan Rickelton being among them.

Veteran all-rounders Sunil Narine and Andre Russell continue to be a part of the LA Knight Riders, but major names like David Miller, Jason Roy, Shakib Al Hasan, and Adam Zampa have been released.

Franchise-wise retention list for MLC 2025

LA Knight Riders: Ali Khan, Adithya Ganesh, Unmukt Chand, Nitish Kumar, Corne Dry, Saif Badar, Shadley van Schalkwyk, Matthew Tromp, Spencer Johnson, Andre Russell, Sunil Narine

MI New York: Ehsan Adil, Nosthush Kenjige, Monank Patel, Heath Richards, Rushil Ugarkar, Sunny Patel, Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Rashid Khan, Trent Boult

San Francisco Unicorns: Corey Anderson, Hassan Khan, Liam Plunkett, Carmi Le Roux, Brody Couch, Karima Gore, Juanoy Drysdale, Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Haris Rauf, Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matthew Short

Seattle Orcas: Harmeet Singh, Cameron Gannon, Ali Sheikh, Ayan Desai, Aaron Jones, Heinrich Klaasen, Ryan Rickelton

Texas Super Kings: Joshua Tromp, Calvin Savage, Milind Kumar, Mohammad Mohsin, Zia-ul-Haq, Saiteja Mukkamalla, Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, Noor Ahmad, Marcus Stoinis

Washington Freedom: Andries Gous, Mukhtar Ahmed, Obus Pienaar, Saurabh Netravalkar, Ian Holland, Amila Aponso, Justin Dill, Lahiru Milantha, Yasir Mohammad, Marco Jansen, Glenn Maxwell, Lockie Ferguson, Rachin Ravindra, Steven Smith, Jack Edwards
summary:
* The defending champions, Washington Freedom, have retained the most players, but notable exclusions include Travis Head and Akeal Hosein. Steve Smith has been retained, but his availability is uncertain due to Australia's tour of the Caribbean coinciding with the MLC 2025.
* San Francisco Unicorns have released big names like Pat Cummins, Matt Henry, and Josh Inglis, but retained their opening pair and pace spearhead Haris Rauf.
* Notable players released by their respective franchises include Kagiso Rabada (MI New York), Matheesha Pathirana (Texas Super Kings), and David Miller (LA Knight Riders).
* Seattle Orcas have retained only seven players, the least among all teams, as they plan for a major revamp after their poor 2024 campaign.
* Other notable retentions include Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, and Marcus Stoinis by the Texas Super Kings, and Sunil Narine and Andre Russell by the LA Knight Riders.

The player draft for the third season is scheduled for February 19.

title: Shakib Al Hasan released by Los Angeles Knight Riders
body:
In a move that comes as little surprise, Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan has been released by the Los Angeles Knight Riders ahead of the 2025 Major League Cricket (MLC) season.

Shakib, now in the twilight of his career, was not among the franchise's retained players as teams finalised their squads for the upcoming campaign.

The veteran cricketer, who is currently unable to bowl due to a suspect action, featured in just four matches for the Knight Riders in the 2024 season, scoring 60 runs and taking a solitary wicket.

The franchise, co-owned by Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan, opted to retain only three overseas players—Sunil Narine and Andre Russell, both long-serving Knight Riders stalwarts, alongside Australian left-arm pacer Spencer Johnson.

Shakib is not the only high-profile player to be released, with England's Jason Roy, South Africa's David Miller, and Australia's Adam Zampa also finding themselves without a team. Even Test stars Pat Cummins (San Francisco Unicorns) and Travis Head (Washington Freedom) have been let go, though this is primarily due to their commitments with Australia's Test squad, which will face the West Indies in June—coinciding with the MLC season. Interestingly, Washington Freedom have retained Steve Smith despite his similar commitments.

Despite being released, Shakib and the other players now enter the draft, set to take place on 19 February, where they will have the opportunity to be picked up by another team—or even return to their previous sides. However, given his recent form and inability to bowl, it remains uncertain whether teams will show interest in Shakib as a specialist batsman.

The 37-year-old last played competitive cricket in November 2024 in the Abu Dhabi T10 League. While he was expected to feature in India's Legend 90 League, he ultimately did not take part. His most recent appearance for Bangladesh came in October 2024 in a Test match against India.

Further complicating matters for Shakib is his political situation. Having been elected as a Member of Parliament for the then-ruling Awami League earlier in 2024, he has been unable to return to Bangladesh following the recent political upheaval. While he had hoped to bid farewell to international cricket with a home Test against South Africa in November, circumstances prevented this from materialising.

As the MLC draft approaches, the cricketing world now waits to see whether Shakib Al Hasan will secure another franchise contract—or if this marks the end of his T20 career.
summary:
* The Los Angeles Knight Riders have released Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan ahead of the 2025 MLC season.
* Shakib was not among the franchise's retained players and will enter the MLC draft on 19 February, where he can be picked up by another team.
* Other high-profile players released include Jason Roy, David Miller, and Adam Zampa, as well as Pat Cummins and Travis Head, who were let go due to their Test commitments with Australia.
* The MLC season is set to coincide with Australia's Test series against the West Indies in June.
* The draft will take place on 19 February, where released players will have the opportunity to be picked up by another team or return to their previous sides.

title: Major League Cricket 2025: Tickets, Teams, and Full Schedule
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) has quickly become a significant name in the world of T20 cricket. With the third season of this exciting league coming in 2025, cricket enthusiasts in the United States and beyond are eagerly waiting for the tournament to kick off. In this article, we’ll explore the ticket prices, schedules, teams, and venues for MLC 2025, including a detailed look at how to secure your spot at the games.

What is Major League Cricket?

Major League Cricket (MLC) is a professional T20 cricket league in the United States. Organized by American Cricket Enterprises and USA Cricket, MLC has rapidly gained attention, especially after becoming the second associate-run franchise competition recognized by the International Cricket Council (ICC). This means the tournament now holds official status, and its playing records are counted as formal statistics in the world of cricket. In 2025, MLC will expand to 10 teams, and the number of matches will increase as well. Fans can expect more exciting cricketing action across multiple venues in the U.S.

MLC Tickets Price 2025

Tickets for the 2025 Major League Cricket season are expected to be available in various price ranges to cater to a wide range of fans. MLC’s Chief Executive has confirmed that with the expansion to 10 teams, ticket sales will be crucial for filling up the venues. Ticket Prices: General Admission: $24 – $50 Premium Seating: $51 – $100 VIP Packages: $101 – $200 These prices offer flexibility for all fans, whether you’re looking for an affordable experience or a more exclusive matchday.

ALSO READ : Vantara Jamnagar Zoo Ticket Price & Entry Details

How to Book MLC Tickets Online?

Booking tickets for MLC 2025 is a simple process: 1. Visit the official ticketing portal (linked on the MLC official website). 2. Choose your match and select the number of tickets. 3. Complete the booking process and confirm your tickets via email.

MLC 2025 Schedule and Venue Information

MLC’s third season will run from July to August 2025, with matches scheduled across various iconic stadiums in the United States. Here’s a glimpse at the confirmed venues for the 2025 season:

Team City Stadium Captain Los Angeles Knight Riders Los Angeles Great Park Cricket Stadium Sunil Narine MI New York New York City Marine Park Cricket Stadium Kieron Pollard San Francisco Unicorns San Francisco Santa Clara County Fairgrounds Stadium Corey Anderson Seattle Orcas Seattle Marymoor Cricket Community Park Heinrich Klaasen Texas Super Kings Texas City Grand Prairie Stadium Faf du Plessis Washington Freedom Washington D.C. TBD Steve Smith

When and Where to Watch MLC 2025?

Fans can watch the live matches of MLC 2025 on Jio Cinema in India and other official streaming platforms globally. Details of specific broadcasters will be updated as the season approaches.

Conclusion

Major League Cricket (MLC) 2025 is set to be an action-packed season with the exciting addition of 10 teams and an increase in the number of matches. Fans can look forward to world-class cricket action in the United States at iconic stadiums. The ticket prices offer a range of options for all fans, from general admission to VIP packages, ensuring everyone has the opportunity to enjoy the tournament. With the official ICC status granted to MLC, the competition is now recognized globally, and its playing records are considered part of formal cricket statistics.

People May Ask

1. What is the official status of Major League Cricket?

Major League Cricket has earned recognition as an official T20 league by the International Cricket Council (ICC). This means MLC’s statistics are now counted as part of official cricket records.

2. How many teams will be playing in MLC 2025?

The third season of Major League Cricket will feature 10 teams—an increase from the previous seasons.

3. How much do tickets cost for MLC 2025?

Ticket prices for MLC 2025 range from $24 for general admission to $200 for VIP packages, depending on the seating and match type.

4. When will the MLC 2025 season start?

The 2025 season will begin in July and end in August, after the conclusion of the T20 World Cup.

5. Where can I buy MLC tickets?

Tickets for MLC 2025 can be purchased through the official MLC website or authorized ticket partners.
summary:
**Overview**: The third season of Major League Cricket (MLC) is set to take place in 2025, featuring 10 teams and an increased number of matches. The tournament will be held in various iconic stadiums across the United States from July to August 2025.

**Ticket Prices**: Tickets will be available in different price ranges, including General Admission ($24-$50), Premium Seating ($51-$100), and VIP Packages ($101-$200).

**How to Book Tickets**: Fans can book tickets online through the official ticketing portal linked on the MLC website.

**Teams and Venues**: The 10 teams participating in MLC 2025 are: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, Washington Freedom, and four other teams (captains and stadiums listed in the article).

**Watch Live**: Fans can watch the live matches of MLC 2025 on Jio Cinema in India and other official streaming platforms globally.

**Key Facts**:

* MLC has earned official ICC recognition, making its playing records part of formal cricket statistics.
* The 2025 season will feature 10 teams and an increased number of matches.
* Tickets will be available in various price ranges to cater to different types of fans.

title: Head, Rabada, and Miller Left Out of MLC 2025 Retentions Ahead of Draft
body:
Several high-profile cricketers, including Travis Head, Pat Cummins, Kagiso Rabada, and David Miller, have been released ahead of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2025 draft on February 19.

Despite being joint-highest scorer for Washington Freedom last season, Travis Head was let go by the defending champions, who opted to retain 15 players, the highest among all six teams.

Other notable releases include:

San Francisco Unicorns dropped Pat Cummins, Matt Henry, and Josh Inglis.

Seattle Orcas let go of Quinton de Kock, Michael Bracewell, and Obed McCoy, keeping only seven players—the fewest among all franchises.

LA Knight Riders retained just three overseas stars: Andre Russell, Sunil Narine, and Spencer Johnson, but released David Miller, Jason Roy, Shakib Al Hasan, and Adam Zampa.

MI New York kept Kieron Pollard, Trent Boult, Nicholas Pooran, and Rashid Khan, but parted ways with Rabada, Anrich Nortje, Tim David, and Dewald Brevis.

Texas Super Kings retained Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, Marcus Stoinis, and Noor Ahmad, while letting go of Mitchell Santner, Daryl Mitchell, and Naveen-ul-Haq.

Which Teams Retained the Most Players?

The Washington Freedom held onto the largest squad, keeping 15 players, including star names Steven Smith, Glenn Maxwell, Lockie Ferguson, and Marco Jansen.

In contrast, Seattle Orcas made the fewest retentions with only seven players, signaling a major squad overhaul in the upcoming draft.

Team Total Players Retained Key Players Retained Washington Freedom 15 Steven Smith, Glenn Maxwell, Lockie Ferguson, Marco Jansen San Francisco Unicorns 12 Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Haris Rauf MI New York 10 Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Rashid Khan, Trent Boult Texas Super Kings 10 Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, Noor Ahmad, Marcus Stoinis LA Knight Riders 11 Andre Russell, Sunil Narine, Spencer Johnson Seattle Orcas 7 Heinrich Klaasen, Ryan Rickelton

Which Domestic Players Were Not Retained?

Some domestic players were also released, including:

Steven Taylor (MI New York)

Shehan Jayasuriya (Seattle Orcas)

Jasdeep Singh (Washington Freedom)

These players will now be available in the MLC 2025 draft pool.

Full List of Retained Players for MLC 2025

LA Knight Riders:

Ali Khan, Adithya Ganesh, Unmukt Chand, Nitish Kumar, Corne Dry, Saif Badar, Shadley van Schalkwyk, Matthew Tromp, Spencer Johnson, Andre Russell, Sunil Narine

MI New York:

Ehsan Adil, Nosthush Kenjige, Monank Patel, Heath Richards, Rushil Ugarkar, Sunny Patel, Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Rashid Khan, Trent Boult

San Francisco Unicorns:

Corey Anderson, Hassan Khan, Liam Plunkett, Carmi Le Roux, Brody Couch, Karima Gore, Juanoy Drysdale, Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Haris Rauf, Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matthew Short

Seattle Orcas:

Harmeet Singh, Cameron Gannon, Ali Sheikh, Ayan Desai, Aaron Jones, Heinrich Klaasen, Ryan Rickelton

Texas Super Kings:

Joshua Tromp, Calvin Savage, Milind Kumar, Mohammad Mohsin, Zia-ul-Haq, Saiteja Mukkamalla, Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, Noor Ahmad, Marcus Stoinis

Washington Freedom:

Andries Gous, Mukhtar Ahmed, Obus Pienaar, Saurabh Netravalkar, Ian Holland, Amila Aponso, Justin Dill, Lahiru Milantha, Yasir Mohammad, Marco Jansen, Glenn Maxwell, Lockie Ferguson, Rachin Ravindra, Steven Smith, Jack Edwards

What to Expect from the MLC 2025 Draft?

The MLC 2025 draft on February 19 will be crucial for teams like Seattle Orcas and LA Knight Riders, who have retained fewer players and need to rebuild their squads.

Several international stars, including Head, Rabada, Miller, Cummins, and de Kock, are now available in the draft, making it one of the most competitive selections yet.

Franchises will look to balance their squads, securing key overseas players and strengthening their domestic rosters.

FAQs

Which team retained the most players for MLC 2025?

Washington Freedom retained 15 players, the highest among all teams.

Who are the biggest names not retained for MLC 2025?

Travis Head, Kagiso Rabada, David Miller, Pat Cummins, and Quinton de Kock were among the major international stars released ahead of the draft.

Which team made the fewest retentions?

Seattle Orcas retained only seven players, indicating a major squad revamp in the draft.

When is the MLC 2025 draft?

The draft is scheduled for February 19, 2025.

Why did Washington Freedom release Travis Head?

Despite being joint-highest scorer last season, Head was not retained as the team opted for different overseas players.

Which domestic players were released?

Notable domestic releases include Steven Taylor (MI New York), Shehan Jayasuriya (Seattle Orcas), and Jasdeep Singh (Washington Freedom).

Can teams still sign released players?

Yes, released players will be available in the MLC 2025 draft, allowing teams to reacquire or replace them.

Who are the top international stars available in the draft?

Rabada, Head, Miller, Cummins, and de Kock are among the biggest names up for grabs in the MLC 2025 draft.
summary:
**Released Players**: Several high-profile cricketers, including Travis Head, Pat Cummins, Kagiso Rabada, and David Miller, have been released ahead of the MLC 2025 draft on February 19.

**Teams' Retention List**: Washington Freedom retained the most players (15), while Seattle Orcas retained the fewest (7). Other teams' retention lists are: San Francisco Unicorns (12), MI New York (10), Texas Super Kings (10), and LA Knight Riders (11).

**Released Domestic Players**: Steven Taylor (MI New York), Shehan Jayasuriya (Seattle Orcas), and Jasdeep Singh (Washington Freedom) are among the domestic players released and available in the draft pool.

**MLC 2025 Draft Expectations**: The draft on February 19 is crucial for teams like Seattle Orcas and LA Knight Riders, who need to rebuild their squads. Several international stars, including Head, Rabada, Miller, Cummins, and de Kock, will be available, making it a competitive selection.

**Key Dates**: The MLC 2025 draft is scheduled for February 19, 2025.

title: Travis Head, Pat Cummins Withdraw from MLC 2025 – Full Squad Retention List
body:
MLC 2025 Retention List: Travis Head, who created a stir with his stormy batting in the IPL, and captain Pat Cummins, who led Sunrisers Hyderabad to the finals last season under his captaincy, have taken a big decision. Both these Australian players will not participate in the Major League Cricket-2025 season.

Travis Head and Pat Cummins Skip MLC 2025 – Full Retention List Announced

Head played an important role in leading Washington Freedom to the title with his stormy batting. He scored a total of 336 runs in nine innings. He was second on the list of highest run-scorers in the season. Head had said a few days ago that he would set a limit on playing in franchise cricket.

At the same time, Freedom has retained Australia’s Steve Smith. However, his availability will depend on the Australian team’s Test matches. Freedom’s team has retained the most domestic cricketers.

Apart from this, Freedom has also retained the most foreign players. Apart from Smith, the franchise has retained Australia’s Glenn Maxwell, Jack Edwards, and New Zealand’s Lockie Ferguson. Akeel Hussain and Andrew Tye have been released by the team.

Also Check: Mitchell Starc Withdraws – Fifth Big Blow for New Zealand Ahead of Champions Trophy

Retained and Released Players in MLC 2025

Washington Freedom

Retained: Steve Smith (depending on the Australian Test schedule), Glenn Maxwell, Jack Edwards, Lockie Ferguson

Released: Akeal Hosein, Andrew Tye

San Francisco Unicorns

Retained: Haris Rauf (only Pakistani player in the squad), Jack Fraser McGurk, Matthew Short, Finn Allen

Released: Josh Inglis (due to Australia vs West Indies Test series)

MI New York

Retained: Tim David

Released: Kagiso Rabada, Dewald Brevis, Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Rashid Khan, Trent Boult

Seattle Orcas

Retained: Ryan Rickelton, Heinrich Klaasen

Released: Quinton de Kock, Mitchell Bracewell, Nandre Burger

Texas Super Kings

Retained: Faf du Plessis (captain), Marcus Stoinis, Devon Conway

Released: Mitchell Santner, Daryl Mitchell, Naveen-ul-Haq, Aiden Markram

Los Angeles Knight Riders

Retained: Sunil Narine, Andre Russell

Released: Jason Roy

New Signings: David Miller, Alex Carey, Shakib Al Hasan, Josh Little
summary:
**Key Players Skipping MLC 2025**

* Travis Head, known for his stormy batting in the IPL, will not participate in MLC 2025.
* Pat Cummins, captain of Sunrisers Hyderabad, will also skip the tournament.

**Retention List by Team**

* Washington Freedom: Retained Steve Smith (availability dependent on Australian Test schedule), Glenn Maxwell, Jack Edwards, and Lockie Ferguson. Released Akeel Hussain and Andrew Tye.
* San Francisco Unicorns: Retained Haris Rauf, Jack Fraser McGurk, Matthew Short, and Finn Allen. Released Josh Inglis due to Australia vs West Indies Test series.
* MI New York: Retained Tim David. Released Kagiso Rabada, Dewald Brevis, Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Rashid Khan, and Trent Boult.
* Seattle Orcas: Retained Ryan Rickelton and Heinrich Klaasen. Released Quinton de Kock, Mitchell Bracewell, and Nandre Burger.
* Texas Super Kings: Retained Faf du Plessis (captain), Marcus Stoinis, and Devon Conway. Released Mitchell Santner, Daryl Mitchell, Naveen-ul-Haq, and Aiden Markram.
* Los Angeles Knight Riders: Retained Sunil Narine and Andre Russell. Released Jason Roy. Made new signings: David Miller, Alex Carey, Shakib Al Hasan, and Josh Little.
